Package com.univpm.po.NutritionStats.service

Class MainService

java.lang.Object
com.univpm.po.NutritionStats.service.MainService
@Service public class MainService extends Object

This is the Service, the SECOND step of any client request. It is the brain behind the endpoint. As you can see, a lot of generics are here used to simplify the appearance of the code, as a matter of fact all the methods below have pretty much the same code except for the method they are referring to. In other words, most of them call the method workOnDiary passing an instance of Method and an array of objects (the parameters of the to-be-called method) as parameters. A lot of recurring code has been rubbed out thanks to generics.

Of course the usage of generics entails the chance for a NoSuchMethodException to be thrown; but as you can read in Controller, this exception may never be thrown since we know these methods exist, however, at the same time, java generics have no guarantee by the compiler before runtime.

Author:
Morelli Valerio

  • Method Details

    • requestAddFoodByName

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestAddFoodByName(String token, String dayId, MealType mealType, String foodName, int portionWeight, Measure measureUnit) throws NoSuchMethodException, UserNotFound, ApiFoodNotFoundException
      /add/food/by_name [POST] route.
      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      dayId - the dayId of the day where to put food
      mealType - the type of meal where to put the food
      foodName - the name of the food to add
      portionWeight - the portion of the food to add
      measureUnit - the unit of measure with which the portion value is given [GR, ML]
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains a message about the error that might occur.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      UserNotFound - when the token doesn't belong to any registered user.
      ApiFoodNotFoundException - when the string foodName doesn't provide any result when submitted as request to Edamam api.
      See Also:
      • for further details about how this endpoint works.

    • requestAddFoodByEan

      public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestAddFoodByEan(String token, String dayId, MealType mealType, long eanCode, int portionWeight) throws NoSuchMethodException, UserNotFound, ApiFoodNotFoundException, ChompLimitOvercameException
      /add/food/by_ean [POST] route.
      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      dayId - the dayId of the day where to put food
      mealType - the type of meal where to put the food
      eanCode - the ean code of the food to add
      portionWeight - the portion of the food to add
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains a message about the error that might occur.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      UserNotFound - when the token doesn't belong to any registered user.
      ApiFoodNotFoundException - when the string eanCode doesn't provide any result when submitted as request to Chomp api.
      ChompLimitOvercameException - due to strict api limitation, we cannot let a high number of requests to pass.
      See Also:
      • for further details about how this endpoint works.

      /stats [POST] route.
      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      types - an array of StatisticType containing all the statistic in with the client is interested

      Returns:

      Throws:

      UserNotFound - when the token doesn't belong to any registered user.
